publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3918 Fiona Hyslop: Fire Services in West Lothian—That the Parliament welcomes the Scottish Executive’s announcement of the £8 million funding package for fire and rescue services in Scotland but notes that this funding will not restore cuts agreed at the Lothian and Borders Fire Board Meeting on 27 January 2006, where Labour, Conservative and Liberal Democrat councillors voted by 15 to 3 not to retain the Craigshill Fire Station in West Lothian as a two-pump wholetime facility, thereby cutting services at night and on the weekend. Supported by: Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Christine Grahame*

S2M-3918 Fiona Hyslop: Fire Services in West Lothian—That the Parliament welcomes the Scottish Executive’s announcement of the £8 million funding package for fire and rescue services in Scotland but notes that this funding will not restore cuts agreed at the Lothian and Borders Fire Board Meeting on 27 January 2006, where Labour, Conservative and Liberal Democrat councillors voted by 15 to 3 not to retain the Craigshill Fire Station in West Lothian as a two-pump wholetime facility, thereby cutting services at night and on the weekend. Supported by: Mr Kenny MacAskill, Christine Grahame
S2M-3918 Fire Services in West Lothian (lodged on 2 February 2006) Michael Matheson*, Mr Adam Ingram*
